title: Download dividend information
body: In the Dividends view, you can download the whole dividend list as an XLXS or CSV file by clicking Export.

title: Download dividend information
body: To download a list of selected dividends, choose the dividends and click Export → Download as XLSX.

title: NAV report
body: FA Fund management app can generate reports that summarize the NAV calculation information as a PDF or XLSX file. To learn more about NAV report content, see NAV report (PDF) and NAV report (XLSX).

title: Download NAV report
body: The system generates NAV reports when you accept NAV in the FA Fund Management app. To download the NAV report in FA Fund Management, do the following:

title: Download NAV report
body: In the NAV status view, double-click the fund to open the NAV overview.

title: Download NAV report
body: In the top right corner of the NAV overview, click the icon to download the report as a PDF or the icon to download the report as an XLSX file.

title: Download NAV report
body: To download NAV reports in FA Back, open the Portfolio window for a fund and go to the Documents tab.

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: You can set up the FA Fund Management app to automatically send out NAV reports via email, for example, every day at a certain time. You need to first enable the sending of reports in FA Fund Management and then set up the sending schedule in FA Back. To do this, take the following steps:

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: In the NAV status view, click on the fund and then click on the icon to open the fund settings.

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: Open the NAV reporting tab.

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: Tick the checkbox for Send report via email and enter the email address of the recipient. You can choose to receive the reports as PDF or XLSX files or both.

title: Send NAV reports via email
body: Schedule the report sending in FA Back. We recommend that your administrator schedules the "Send documents via email" process (for instructions, see Scheduling in FA Admin guide).

title: About FA Advisor
body: FA Advisor app provides advisors with tools for managing customer-related tasks and onboarding new customers. You can use FA Advisor to do the following:

title: About FA Advisor
body: Work with customers

title: About FA Advisor
body: Maintain up-to-date customer information. You can view your customers, or all customers in the system, and select an individual customer to view and edit their details.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Add customer-related notes and store documents.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer-related tasks: calls, emails, letters, and meetings.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Onboard new customers.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Manage customer investments

title: About FA Advisor
body: View a summary of a customer's investments or see more details in FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Trade for the customer via FA Client Portal.

title: About FA Advisor
body: Keep track of unsigned trade orders that the customer needs to accept.

title: User access
body: To have access to FA Advisor, users need to have the correct rights in FA Admin Console.

title: User access
body: To provide advisors access to FA Advisor, do the following:

title: User access
body: Ensure the FA Advisor application is enabled. Contact FA if you need to enable it.

title: User access
body: In FA Admin Console, assign the user the ROLE_USER right within the FA Advisor role (see Access to FA functionality in FA Admin guide).

title: User access
body: If limited visibility is in use, it also applies to FA Advisor and the user can see the same customers as in FA Back (see Access for employees in FA Admin guide).

title: Work with customers
body: FA Advisor enables you to access customer profiles in the FA Platform to work with your customers. Customer profiles are created in FA Back as contacts, and FA Advisor allows you to maintain up-to-date information about a customer as well as manage tasks, documents, and notes related to them.

title: View and edit customer information
body: The Customers view gives you an overview of customers. You can:

title: View and edit customer information
body: View only your customers (default view) or select "Show all customers" in the Customer group drop-down to see all customers in the system.

title: View and edit customer information
body: Filter the list, sort the content by clicking on column titles, save a view you created, and open it again later by clicking Save view. To manage saved views, click .

title: View and edit customer information
body: Export the list as a CSV file or print it by clicking the Export button.

title: View and edit customer information
body: Open customer details by clicking  in the Actions column.

title: View and edit customer information
body: Access the customer's FA Client Portal app to view their investments or trade for them by clicking  in the Actions column.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: The following information is available as columns or fields in FA Advisor:

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Unique ID defined for a customer in FA Back. Customer ID can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact ID in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: External ID

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer ID in an external system, for example, identity number or social security number. The external ID can be used to set up client authentication in FA.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Name

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Name of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer type

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Contact type specified in FA Back. Customer type can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window, Type field).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Representatives

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Advisor or asset manager who represents the customer and optional tags assigned to them. Representatives can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit the representatives in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Taxation country

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Taxation country of the customer. Taxation country can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Phone numbers 1 and 2

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer's phone numbers.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Email

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Email address of the customer.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Address (Address 1, Address 2, Postal code, City, Country)

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Customer’s address information.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Tags assigned to the customer in the system. Tags are used, for example, to set up access to customer portfolios, manage trade orders, or produce reports. Tags can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit them in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Juridical form

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Juridical form of the customer, for example, private person or company. Juridical form can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Identity

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Identity format of the customer, for example passport. Identity can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Nationality

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Nationality of the customer. Nationality can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Classification

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Trading classification of the customer, for example, professional or non-professional. Classification can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Transaction no. level

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Level at which the system generates transaction numbers. This is either the portfolio level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within the portfolio, or the contact level where the transaction number is individual to each transaction within all of the contact's portfolios. Transaction no. level can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Status of the customer record in the system (active, passive, or closed). Customer status can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Order status

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Advisors

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Names of the customer's advisors.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Cash

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Amount of cash in the customer's accounts.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Investments

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Amount of investments in the customer's portfolios, excluding cash.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Total assets

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Combined amount of the customer's cash and investments.

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Language

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Language of reports for the customer. If no language is selected, the reports are printed out in Finnish. Language can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit it in FA Back (Contact window).

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Representees

title: Customer information in FA Advisor
body: Persons the customer represents and optional tags assigned to them. Representees can't be edited in FA Advisor. You can edit the representees in FA Back (Representatives tab in Contact window).

title: Add notes and documents
body: The Notes section at the bottom of Customer details view allows you to add your customer-related notes, store documents like agreements or investment plans, and maintain meeting notes about customer meetings. If the customer has a contact memo in FA Back, you can see it in FA Advisor.

title: Add notes and documents
body: We recommend not using Firefox as your browser when working with notes in FA Advisor. Using Firefox causes the note text to be displayed without spacing.

title: Manage notes
body: Notes are structured in tabs (one note per tab). You can add information about the customer in the Customer info tab or add more tabs.

title: Manage notes
body: In the FA Back note tab, you can view the contact memo for the customer which is imported from the Contact window in FA Back. This is useful if you have previously used the contact memo in FA Back to store information about the customer and want to see it in FA Advisor. You can't edit or delete the memo directly in FA Advisor.

title: Manage notes
body: To add a new tab with a note, do the following:

title: Manage notes
body: Click + Add tab.

title: Manage notes
body: Enter a name for the tab in Note name.

title: Manage notes
body: Add your notes in the text editor.

title: Manage notes
body: Click Save.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The Meeting notes tab allows you to add notes about meetings and link them to specific dates.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: To add a meeting note, do the following:

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Click Add meeting note. If you have meeting note templates in FA Back, you can create a Blank note or select From template and choose from the saved templates. For more information about meeting note templates, see Manage documents in FA User guide.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Enter a name and date for the note and add content in the text editor.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Click Save.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: You can see the following information for each meeting note:

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Meeting note name

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The name of the meeting note.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Meeting date

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The date of the meeting.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Author

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The user ID of the user who added the meeting note.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Modified date

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The date the meeting note was modified.

title: Manage meeting notes
body: Last modified by

title: Manage meeting notes
body: The user ID of the user who last modified the meeting note.

title: Store documents
body: In the Documents tab, you can see the documents uploaded for the customer. You can track the signing status and check the FA Client Portal availability of each document. To add documents, do the following:

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload.

title: Store documents
body: Add your documents by dragging and dropping or selecting the files from your computer.

title: Store documents
body: Fill in the fields: Category, Signing status, Show in FA Client Portal. See the field descriptions below.

title: Store documents
body: Click Upload.

title: Store documents
body: To edit the category, signing status, or availability in FA Client Portal for an uploaded document, click in the Actions column.

title: Store documents
body: You can see the following information for each document:

title: Store documents
body: Category

title: Store documents
body: The category of the document, for example, agreement or investment plan. You can configure document categories in FA Back (Preference, Document tags).

title: Store documents
body: Document name

title: Store documents
body: The file name and extension. The supported file types are: PDF, DOC, DOCX, ODT, XLS, XLSX, PPT, PPTX, ODP, ODS, TXT, CSV, XML, PNG, JPG, RTF, and MP3.

title: Store documents
body: Uploaded by

title: Store documents
body: The user ID of the user who uploaded the document.

title: Store documents
body: Upload date

title: Store documents
body: The upload date and time of the document.

title: Store documents
body: Signing status

title: Store documents
body: The signing status of the document, for example, pending or expired. You can configure document signing tags in FA Back (Preference, Document tags). Sending documents for signing is handled in FA Back (see Send documents for signing in FA User guide), and the current status of a document is reflected in FA Advisor.

title: Store documents
body: FA Client Portal

title: Store documents
body: The availability of the document to the customer in FA Client Portal. To make documents available in FA Client Portal, enable Show in FA Client Portal when uploading them.

title: Manage tasks
body: Tasks allow you to set due dates for actions related to a customer. A task can be a call, an email, a letter, or a meeting. Each task also has a status that changes from "Open" to "Overdue" once the due date you set has passed. When you are done with a task, you can mark it as completed.

title: Manage tasks
body: The following sections describe how you can add tasks, search for existing tasks, and complete tasks that are ready.

title: Add a task
body: You can add a new task related to a customer by doing the following:

title: Add a task
body: In the Customer details, Open tasks section, click Add task and select the task type (call, email or letter, meeting).

title: Add a task
body: Fill in the task information:

title: Add a task
body: Due date*

title: Add a task
body: Date by which the task should be completed.

title: Add a task
body: Note

title: Add a task
body: Notes about the task.

title: Add a task
body: Mark task as completed

title: Add a task
body: Checkbox to indicate the task is done. If you tick the checkbox, the task status becomes "Completed".

title: Add a task
body: Click Save.

title: Add a task
body: Alternatively, you can click Add task in the Tasks view and select the customer the task is related to after choosing the task type.

title: Complete a task
body: When you are done with a task, you can mark it as complete by doing the following:

title: Complete a task
body: Click the icon in the Actions column of a task to open the side pane.

title: Complete a task
body: Tick the checkbox Mark task as completed.

title: Complete a task
body: Click Save.

title: Complete a task
body: The task status is now changed to "Completed".

title: View and search tasks
body: To see the open tasks related to a customer, open their Customer details and see the Open tasks section.

title: View and search tasks
body: To view all tasks and search through them, open the Tasks view. In the Tasks view, you can search for tasks based on the assignee, task type, and status. You can see only tasks assigned to you by selecting "Assigned to me" for the Assignee filter.

title: View and search tasks
body: You can view the details of a task by clicking the icon in the Actions column. This opens a side pane that shows the contact details of the customer as well as the due date and notes of the task. The side pane also allows you to delete the task by clicking Delete.

title: Available task information
body: The following information is available for tasks:

title: Available task information
body: Assignee

title: Available task information
body: User the task is assigned to.

title: Available task information
body: Customer

title: Available task information
body: Name of the customer the task relates to.

title: Available task information
body: Creator

title: Available task information
body: User who created the task.

title: Available task information
body: Due date

title: Available task information
body: Date by which the task should be completed.

title: Available task information
body: Note

title: Available task information
body: Notes about the task.

title: Available task information
body: Status

title: Available task information
body: Task status ("Open", "Overdue", or "Completed"). The "Overdue" status is applied to tasks with a due date in the past. The "Completed" status is applied to tasks marked as complete.

title: Available task information
body: Task type

title: Available task information
body: Type of action. Available task types are call, email or letter, and meeting.

title: Manage customer investments
body: FA Advisor allows you to view and manage your customers' investments. You can view a summary of customer investments in FA Advisor or access FA Client Portal for more detailed information. You can also trade for the customer via FA Client Portal.

title: View customer investments
body: In FA Advisor, you can view a summary of a customer's investments as a pie chart or table in Customer details, Investments section. The pie chart shows the portfolio name, ID, and total value for active portfolios. If the customer has more than 10 portfolios, the pie chart only displays 10 of them with the smallest portfolios grouped as one chart section. Portfolios with less than 5% of the total value are also grouped in the pie chart.

title: View customer investments
body: For more detailed information about a customer's investments, you can access FA Client Portal. To open FA Client Portal, click the icon in the Customers view, Actions column. Alternatively, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right of the Customer details.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: You can buy and sell securities and make switch, deposit, and withdrawal orders for the customer via FA Client Portal. When you create an order in FA Client Portal, it needs to be signed by the customer before being executed.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: To make an order for the customer, do the following:

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: In the Customers view, click the icon in the Actions column. Alternatively, click Open FA Client Portal in the top right of the Customer details. The customer's FA Client Portal opens.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Check that you have the rights to make and cancel orders in the banner at the top of the view. Allowed actions have a green check mark next to them.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: Make the order. For information on how to trade securities and make switch, deposit and withdrawal orders, see FA Client Portal documentation.

title: Trade via FA Client Portal
body: The order you created is tagged with "Advisor" in FA Back and has the signing status "Pending" until the customer accepts it. The customer's Status column in the Customers view now shows "Unsigned trade orders".

title: Cancel an order
body: You can cancel orders in the customer's FA Client Portal app. For details on how to cancel orders, see Orders view in FA Client Portal.

title: View pending orders
body: If a customer has pending orders waiting for acceptance, you can see an indicator in the following places:

title: View pending orders
body: Customers view, Status column: Shows "Unsigned trade orders".

title: View pending orders
body: Customer details: Shows a bell icon next to the customer's name at the top of the view. Hovering your mouse over the bell icon shows the unsigned trade orders from the oldest to the newest.

title: View pending orders
body: You can use these indicators to keep track of customers who need to be contacted, for example.

title: Scheduling
body: You can configure FA processes to run at specific times. The scheduling is done with Cron expressions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To create and manage schedules, open Tools → Administer → Scheduled functions in the top menu. After selecting a scheduled process, you can see the Cron schedule specified for it. This means a regular execution time has been set for the process.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: To add a new schedule:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Add button and fill in the fields:

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Cron schedule

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The process schedule specified using Cron syntax (see Cron schedules). The next execution time is shown when a valid Cron schedule is entered.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Configuration

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The configuration used for the schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Saved views

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: The saved view, if it’s relevant for the process you are scheduling. The saved view can be e.g. saved transaction view if you are scheduling a functionality that runs against a list of transactions.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click Save to save the schedules. Alternatively, you can click Remove to delete a schedule.

title: Create, edit and remove schedules
body: Click the Run button to test your configurations. The functionality is run with the configuration set and saved view you specified.

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the Cron syntax. The basic principles are:

title: Cron schedules
body: The schedules are specified in the following order, with space separating each component:

title: Cron schedules
body: Seconds

title: Cron schedules
body: Minutes

title: Cron schedules
body: Hours

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-month

title: Cron schedules
body: Month

title: Cron schedules
body: Day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Year (optional)

title: Cron schedules
body: Asterisk ( * ) can be used to specify any value (for example, * as the Day-of-month component indicates that the schedule is run every day of the month).

title: Cron schedules
body: Question mark (?) can be used in day-of-month and day-of-week fields to specify “no specific value”.

title: Cron schedules
body: Some examples of different kinds of schedules:

title: Cron schedules
body: Daily at 15:00:

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first second of the first minute of the 15th hour, every day of month and every month, regardless of the day-of-week

title: Cron schedules
body: Every Friday at 12:30:

title: Cron schedules
body: Every weekday (Monday through Friday) at 08:10:20

title: Cron schedules
body: 20 10 08 ? * MON-FRI

title: Cron schedules
body: On the first day of every month at 21:00

title: User management view
body: The User management view allows you to manage FA platform users and their access rights to applications. To view and edit user information, click a user in the list – the User details pane opens.

title: User management view
body: You can search for users with filters and sort the search results by clicking on the column titles. For the column descriptions, see User details and account information. You can save the view you created to open it again later (click ). To manage saved views, click .

title: User management view
body: To download the whole user list in the XLXS file, click Export → Download as XLSX. To download the list of selected users, choose the users and click Export → Download as XLSX.

title: Add a user
body: To create a user account:

title: Add a user
body: Click Add user at the top-right corner and fill in the user information:

title: Add a user
body: The User ID used as a username at login and Email (required fields).

title: Add a user
body: Linked contact to set up access to client data or access to FA Front access with the external identity provider.

title: Add a user
body: Other fields if needed. See User details and account information for details.

title: Add a user
body: Click Edit user roles in the User details pane and choose which apps your user can access and with what roles.

title: Add a user
body: To access an app, a user needs a role for it – a user without any roles can't access any application.

title: Add a user
body: Let the user know about their credentials and how to get a password.

title: Add a user
body: Send them the user ID – FA platform doesn't send this information automatically.

title: Add a user
body: Instruct the user to request a password reset link by clicking Forgot password on the login page.

title: Deactivate a user
body: If a user doesn't need to access the platform anymore, we recommend deactivating their account rather than deleting it – this maintains the user's history while preventing them from accessing FA.

title: Deactivate a user
body: To change the status for multiple users, choose the users in the list and click . To change the status for one user, click in the User details pane. You can see the user's status in the list of users:

title: Deactivate a user
body: Active – The user can log in to the FA platform.

title: Deactivate a user
body: Inactive – The user can't log in to the FA platform.

title: Delete a user
body: Deleting a user removes all user information from the system. A deleted user can’t log in. If you just want to disable a user and prevent them from logging in, consider deactivating the user instead of deleting the account. To delete a user, click in the User details pane.

title: Assign user roles
body: The Roles block in the User details pane shows the roles assigned to the user. Roles determine:

title: Assign user roles
body: The app the user can access. To access an app, the user needs at least one role within that app. For example, if a user has a right in FA Back, the user is allowed to access FA Back.

title: Assign user roles
body: The access rights within the app. For example, FA Back roles determine access rights through permission and FA Front roles determine access rights through the views defined for the role.

title: Assign user roles
body: To add or remove the user’s roles, click Edit user roles at the top of the User details pane.

title: Manage authentication
body: You can manage user authentication using the following options:

title: Password reset
body: You can force the user to reset their password on next login. To force a password reset for multiple users, choose the users in the list and click . To force password reset for a selected user, click in the User details pane, choose Force password reset on next login and save the changes.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Two-factor authentication is a login option that requires entering a verification code in addition to the basic credentials (user ID and password). You can check two-factor authentication status in the User details pane:

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disabled – Two-factor authentication is turned off.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enabled – Two-factor authentication is turned on. The user has logged in and completed the mobile authenticator setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Pending – Two-factor authentication is turned on. You chose “Enable two-factor authentication on next login”, but the user didn’t yet log in to complete the setup.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: To manage two-factor authentication, use the buttons (available depending on the two-factor authentication status):

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Enable two-factor authentication on the next login for the user.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Cancel two-factor authentication request that is pending.

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication

title: Two-factor authentication
body: Disable two-factor authentication for the user.

title: Brute force detection
body: FA Platform uses brute force detection to identify attempts to guess a user’s password. Brute force detection temporarily disables the user's account after a certain number and frequency of login failures. The user account is disabled for one minute if:

title: Brute force detection
body: The user enters incorrect credentials twice within a second. This means that someone tries to guess the password programmatically.

title: Brute force detection
body: The user fails to enter correct credentials 5 times. After the account is disabled, every unsuccessful attempt increases the lock by one minute, up to one hour.

title: Brute force detection
body: To check if a user account is disabled by the brute force detection, open the User details pane and go to the Brute force detection section. It includes the following information:

title: Brute force detection
body: Status

title: Brute force detection
body: Brute force detection status of the user account: Blocked (deactivated by brute force detection), or Unblocked (active). A user blocked by brute force detection has to wait for up to 1 hour (depending on the number of unsuccessful login attempts) for the account to be unblocked.

title: Brute force detection
body: Total login attempts

title: Brute force detection
body: The number of failed login attempts.

title: Brute force detection
body: Last attempt

title: Brute force detection
body: The date and time of the last login attempt.

title: Brute force detection
body: IP address

title: Brute force detection
body: The IP address from which the last login attempt was made.

title: Brute force detection
body: To activate a blocked user account, choose Unblock and activate. Once unblocked, your user can log in again without waiting for the system to unblock the user after a certain time.

title: User details and account information
body: The list of users and the User details pane on the right show the following information:

title: User account information
body: User ID (required)

title: User account information
body: A unique user ID for logging in to FA and log the user's activities.

title: User account information
body: Email (required)

title: User account information
body: The user’s email to send a password reset link to the user, if the user clicks Forgot password on the login page.

title: User account information
body: First name, Last name

title: User account information
body: The user’s first and last name.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact

title: User account information
body: The corresponding contact in FA Back. Linked contact is needed to:

title: User account information
body: Grant access only to certain customers and portfolios (see the Set up limited visibility for one user and Set up limited visibility for many users sections in the FA Admin guide).

title: User account information
body: Allow online end users to view their own investments in FA Front. A user that has a linked contact has access to the investment information associated with this contact.

title: User account information
body: Linked contact external ID

title: User account information
body: The user’s external ID received from the external identity provider when the user logs in to FA Front. External ID is used to find a matching contact for the user. If you see this field, this means that FA failed to link a contact to the user. For example, there is no contact with such an ID or there are several contacts with this ID stored in FA. In this case, you can add a contact manually in the Linked contact field.

title: User account information
body: Status

title: User account information
body: The user account status: active (the user can log in to FA) or inactive (the user can't log in to the system). See Assign user roles for details.

title: Sessions
body: The Sessions block shows a list of currently active sessions for the user. For example, the same user might have logged in with different browsers, having multiple sessions open at the same time. The list shows:

title: Sessions
body: Application

title: Sessions
body: The apps where the user is logged in within the session. For example, the user might have FA Back and FA Front open in different tabs in the same browser, accessing both applications with a single login and a single session.

title: Sessions
body: Last access

title: Sessions
body: The date and time the user accessed an app within the session. If the user accesses only one app, this shows the time they logged in, or if your user accesses multiple apps, this shows the time the user last opened a new app.

title: Sessions
body: IP address

title: Sessions
body: Shows the IP address the user is logged in from.

title: Sessions
body: You can log the user out of all sessions by clicking Log out user from all sessions. The user will be able to use FA for a short time until their authentication expires, then they will get a "communication problem" and will be taken to the login page.

title: Last logins
body: The Last logins block shows date and time of the five last user logins.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: # Code Required Name Description

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 1 c.contactId Yes Contact ID Unique ID for the contact (e.g. social security number or other unique identifier).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 2 c.externalId No External contact ID E.g. social security number or other additional identification.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 3 c.name Yes Name Contact name (e.g. first name and last name, company name, etc.).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 4 c.type Yes Type Define as a number: 1 = Customer 2 = Asset manager 3 = Broker 4 = Accountant 5 = Issuer 6 = Custody 7 = Lead

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 5 c.juridical Yes Juridical form Juridical form code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 6 c.status Yes Status Use the code of the status: A = Active P = Passive C = Closed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 7 c.taxCountry Yes Tax country Country code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 8 c.memo No Memo Text, memo information

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 9 c.classification Yes Classification Classification code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 10 c.identity Yes Identity Identity code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 11 c.address1 No Address 1

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 12 c.address2 No Address 2

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 13 c.zipCode No Zip code

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 14 c.city No City

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 15 c.country No Country

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 16 c.phone1 No Phone 1

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 17 c.phone2 No Phone 2

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 18 c.fax No Fax

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 19 c.email No Email

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 20 c.electronicCommunication No Electronic communication Define as a number: 1 = allow electronic communication 0 = not allowed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 21 c.marketingCommunication No Marketing communication Define as a number: 1 = allow marketing communication 0 = not allowed

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 22 c.nationality No Nationality Country code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 23 c.representatives No Representatives Comma-separated list of contact IDs representing the contact, for example, 1223,1224,1225. To import tag values for a contact representative, add them after ###: Add standalone tags as <representative's contact ID>###<tag name 1>#<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Standalone1#Standalone2Add single-select group tags as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name 1>#<group name>-<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Permission-View#Relationship type-AdvisorAdd multi-select group tags as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>#<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Permission for trade orders:Make#Permission for trade orders:ModifyTo import multiple types of tags simultaneously, separate the tags with #. For example: 04012000###Permission-View#Employee:Finance#Employee:Accounting#Relationship type-Advisor#Standalone1#Standalone2 You can use *** syntax to add new representatives and keep existing ones (for example: ***,04012000###...). For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To add representatives to a contact without any existing representatives, add "???," at the beginning of the column's content (for example: ???,04012000####...). If the contact already has representatives, existing representatives will be kept and the new ones are not added.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 24 c.language No Language Language code (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 25 c.subType No Sub type Contact sub type code (configured in the system). When a sub type is given, it will find its own parent contact type and override the given contact type's code (in column 4).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 26 c.transactionExtIdLevel No Transaction no. level Define as a number: 1 = Portfolio level 2 = Contact level

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 27 c.contactExchanges No Settlement place Comma-separated list of contact settlement places with settlement place code (configured in the system) and counter information with BIC code. Use the following syntax to import settlement place information: <settlement place code>=<counter>. E.g. APKEFIHH=ESSEFIHX,MGTCBEBE=ESSEFIHX

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 28 c.tags No Tags Comma-separated list of tags. Tags import allows you to add new tags: Standalone tags are added with a <tag name>. For example: Fund,ContractOK.Single-select group tags should be added as <group name>-<tag name>. For example: office-Helsinki. If a contact already has a tag with the same group name, the tag is replaced.Multi-select group tags should be added as a comma-separated list of values <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: Interests:Golf,Interests:Culture. If a contact already has tags with the same group name, the new tag is added to the existing ones. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a tag: Standalone tags: ---<tag name>. For example: ---Fund,---ContractOK.Single-select group tags: ---<group name>-<tag name>. For example: —office-Helsinki.Multi-select group tags: ---<group name>:<tag name 1>,---<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: ---Interests:Golf,---Interests:Culture. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 29 c.classification2 No Classification 2 Classification 2 code (configured in the system).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 30 c.classification3 No Classification 3 Classification 3 code (configured in the system).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 31 c.profileAttributes No Profile Contact-specific profile (configured in the system). Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Note that importing checkbox fields requires you to use the type "boolean" and importing date fields requires you to use the type "date" in the syntax. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced or removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove a profile attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 32 c.extContactIdList No External IDs List of contact's external ID's. Use the following syntax <ext_id1=ext_name1>,<ext_id2=ext_name2> etc. If ext_id and ext_name combination for the same contact exist just use the existing one, otherwise create new one. If ext_id and ext_name combination exist but for a different contact, will show error message.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 33 c.keyFigures No Key figures Define the key figure code and individual observations as date-value pairs as a comma-separated list with the format <code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value&>&<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>:<code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,... E.g. AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 When importing categorized key figures (e.g. 1=Low, 2=Medium, 3=High), prior to 3.7.7 you should use the "number" (e.g. 1, 2 or 3), and after 3.7.7 you should use the "text" (e.g. Low, Medium, High). You can use *** syntax to add new observations and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:BBB=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=3. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing contacts
body: 34 c.parent No Issuer group Contact ID of the issuer group. Available only for contacts of the Issuer type.

When creating a new portfolio, define AUTO to automatically use the next available number as the portfolio ID, if the "Generate a running number for portfolio ID automatically" is enabled in Portfolios Preferences.

To import representative tag values, add them after ###: Add standalone tags as <representative's contact ID>###<tag name 1>#<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Standalone1#Standalone2Add single-select group tags as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name 1>#<group name>-<tag name 2>. For example: 258258###Permission-View#Relationship type-AdvisorAdd multi-select group tags as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>#<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Permission for trade orders:Make#Permission for trade orders:ModifyTo import multiple types of tags simultaneously, separate the tags with #. title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 17 p.contact No Other contacts Portfolio's other contacts. Contact IDs as a comma-separated list. To import representative tag values, add them after ###: Add standalone tags as <representative's contact ID>###<tag name 1>#<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Standalone1#Standalone2Add single-select group tags as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name 1>#<group name>-<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Permission-View#Relationship type-AdvisorAdd multi-select group tags as <representative's contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>#<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Permission for trade orders:Make#Permission for trade orders:ModifyTo import multiple types of tags simultaneously, separate the tags with #. For example: 04012000###Permission-View#Employee:Finance#Employee:Accounting#Relationship type-Advisor#Standalone1#Standalone2

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 18 Default account Not used.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 19 p.accounts No Accounts  A colon-separated (:) list of the portfolio accounts. To add accounts to a portfolio, use the following syntax: <Account no.>,<Currency with currency code>,<Name>,<Visibility as 0=not visible 1=visible>,<Shared as 0=not shared 1=shared>,<Priority as integer>;<BIC code>,<Mandate>,<Secondary account number>,<Category>,<Account type as 0=not cash, 1=cash, 2=credit>,<Hide if zero as 0=don’t hide, 1=hide>,<Tags separated with #>,<Issuer with contact ID>,<Calendar with the calendar code>,<Fixing as a number>,<Base instrument with the security code>,<Spread as a number>,<Exclude balance as 0=don't exclude, 1=exclude>,<Shared with all as 0=not shared, 1=shared>, <Shared to all parent portfolio's subportfolios as 0=not shared, 1=shared>, <Decimals for transactions as a number>, <Transaction type code>, <Offset days as an integer>. For example, a list of two accounts: FI12 3456 78,EUR,Euro account,1,0,1,NDEAFIHHXXX,12345678,12345-678,Bank account,1,0,Client account#Status OK:234-321,USD,Dollar account,0,1,2,,,,,1,0,Client account#Status OK,,Act/360,0.2,LIBOR,1.5,0,0,0,4 The account currency (second in the syntax) is validated to be a valid currency in the system. Supported calendar codes: 1/130/360ISDA30/360 PSA30E+/36030E/36030E/360 ISDA30U/36030U/36030U/360 EOMAct/360Act/364Act/365 ActualAct/365.25Act/365FAct/365LAct/366Act/366.375Act/Act AFBAct/Act ICMAAct/Act ISDAAct/Act YearNL/365 You can use *** syntax to add new accounts for the portfolio while keeping the old ones, but this is not required. Without ***, old values are still preserved. For example: ***:<Account>:<Account>). For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. To update the account number of an existing account, use the syntax "[old account no]new account no" in the first field of the account syntax. For example, if you want to update an account number from 1000 to 1010, define the account number in the syntax as [1000]1010. To keep the accounts unchanged, import an empty value in the field. Existing accounts cannot be removed using import.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 20 p.assetManagers No Asset managers Portfolio's asset managers. Contact IDs as a comma-separated list. To import representative tag values, add them after ###. Standalone tags are added as <contact ID>###<tag name>. For example: 04012000##parent.Single-select group tags are added as <contact ID>###<group name>-<tag name>. For example: 04012000##relative-parent.Multi-select group tags are added as a comma-separated list of values: <contact ID>###<group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>. For example: 04012000###Employee:Finance,Employee:Accounting.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 21 p.fees No Fees List of portfolio fees: <type>=<fee percent>. Types are: transaction, payment, withdrawal, management. E.g. transaction=2.3, management=1.5 You can use *** syntax to add fees to the portfolio and keep the existing ones. For example: ***,payment=3,withdrawal=3.9. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 22 p.startDate No Start date yyyy-MM-dd, portfolio start date

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 23 p.updateDate No Update date yyyy-MM-dd, portfolio update

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 24 p.ruleSet No Posting rule Code of the posting rule set. For multiple posting rule sets, use comma-separated list of posting rule set codes (available from FA 3.12 onward).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 25 p.extPortfolioIdList No External IDs List of portfolio's external ID's. Use the following syntax <ext_id1=ext_name1>,<ext_id2=ext_name2> etc. If ext_id and ext_name combination for the same portfolio exist just use the existing one, otherwise create new one. If ext_id and ext_name combination exist but for a different portfolio, will show error message.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 26 p.benchmark No Benchmark Benchmark code (configured in the system) or in order to use portfolio specific benchmarks, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<security1 code>=<share1>,<security code2>=<share2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<security code3>=<share3> etc. You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the existing benchmark and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 27 p.country No Country Country code (configured in the system), if not given will use primary contact's tax country

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 28 p.juridical No Juridical Juridical form code (configured in the system), if not given will use primary contact's juridical form

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 29 p.emailAddresses No Email addresses Comma-separated list of email addresses. E.g. a@fasolutions.com, b@fasolutions.com

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 30 p.reportContacts No Report contacts Comma-separated list of contact IDs

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 31 p.closeMethod No Close method Define as a number: 0 = "Choose" 1 = "No change" 2 = "Depreciation" 3 = "Depreciation and refund" 4 = "Market value"

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 32 p.portfolioGroups No Portfolio groups Portfolio groups the portfolio is in. Specify the portfolio groups as a comma-separated list of group codes. You can use *** to add new groups to the portfolio while keeping the existing ones. For example: ***,<group code>. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 33 p.custody No Custody Contact for the custody (use the Contact ID to identify the custody).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 34 p.bookEntry No Book entry String value for book entry account

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 35 p.modelPortfolio No Model portfolio Name of the model portfolio (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 36 p.costFormulas No Cost formula Comma-separated list of cost formula codes (configured in the system)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 37 p.tags No Tags "The "Tags" field is a comma-separated list of tags that you can use to categorize your portfolios. To add a tag:  Standalone tags can be added by simply typing the tag name. For example, if you want to add a tag for a Fund and a tag for a ContractOK, you can add them like this: "Fund,ContractOK".Single-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>-<tag name>. For example, if you want to add a tag for an office location in Helsinki, you can add it like this: "office-Helsinki". If a portfolio already has a tag with the same group name, the new tag will replace the old one.Multi-select group tags should be added in the format <group name>:<tag name 1>,<group name>:<tag name 2>, etc. For example, if you want to add tags for stocks and bonds in your Investments group, you can add them like this: "Investments:Stocks,Investments:Bonds". If a portfolio already has tags with the same group name, the new tags will be added to the existing ones. To remove a tag, use the syntax "---" followed by the tag name or tag group name. For example:  To remove a standalone tag for "Fund", you can use "---Fund".To remove a single-select group tag for "office-Helsinki", you can use "---office-Helsinki".To remove multi-select group tags for "Investments:Stocks" and "Investments:Bonds", you can use "---Investments:Stocks,---Investments:Bonds". For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 38 p.priceSource No Price source The method to determine the close market price for the securities in the portfolio. To use the prices from Security's Market data info tab, leave the field empty. To use the first available price from the price fields in the Security's Market data info tab (checking the column values in the order specified above), specify Default. To define a different priority of price source fields, enter a comma-separated list of columns in the order of priority. The values are: Manual, Close 1, Close 2, Close 3, Close 4, Close 5. You can use *** syntax to add new values in the list of price source fields and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. You can use three minuses (for example, ---Close 1) to remove a value.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 39 p.investmentPlan No Investment plan Portfolio-specific investment plan, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<security 1 code>=<share 1>,<security 2 code>=<share 2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<security 3 code>=<share 3> etc. If you want to import an investment plan with minimum and maximum shares, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<securityCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1>,<securityCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>;<yyyy-MM-dd>;,<securityCode3>=<share3#minShare3#maxShare3> etc. Min and max shares are validated to align in relation to the target share (i.e. min smaller / max higher or equal to the target). (Available from FA 3.8 onward) You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the investment plan and keep the existing ones. For example: ***:2019-01-01,NOKIA=25#20#30,AMAZON=15#10#20. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 40 p.profileAttributes No Profile Portfolio-specific profile (configured in the system). Use the following syntax to import / update profile information: <key>=<value>:<type>#<key>=<value>:<type> etc. Note that importing checkbox fields requires you to use the type "boolean" and importing date fields requires you to use the type "date" in the syntax. Profile import allows you to add or modify profile values with a specific key - existing profile values are not replaced / removed unless you specifically include their key within the import syntax. To remove an attribute value, use the syntax described in Updating contacts and portfolios. For example: :---<key>. You can use three minuses (---) syntax to remove an attribute value. For example: ---<key>. For details, see Removing contact and portfolio values with three minuses (---).

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 41 p.strategy No Strategy Portfolio specific strategy, use the following syntax <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1#FIXED>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode3#asset & GroupCode3>=<share3#minShare3#maxShare3> etc. For interpolation, specify "INTERPOLATION", calendar code, and two dates before the asset types. For example: INTERPOLATION=SatSun:<yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=<share1#minShare1#maxShare1>,<assetTypeCode2#assetGroupCode2>=<share2#minShare2#maxShare2>, etc. For an asset type that is excluded from strategy analysis, specify "EXCLUDED" followed by three dots: <yyyy-MM-dd>,<assetTypeCode1#assetGroupCode1>=EXCLUDED... You can use *** syntax to add new entries to the strategy and keep the existing ones, for example: ***:2019-01-01,ASSET#MOD=100#0#100. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 42 p.parent No Parent portfolio Comma-separated list of parent portfolios' Portfolio IDs. The imported portfolio will be marked as the sub-portfolio to all the defined parent / main portfolios. You can use *** syntax to add new parent portfolios and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 43 p.accruedInterestValuation No Accrued interest Define as a number: 0 = "Transaction date" 1 = "Settlement date" If no value is filled in, the default value 0 "Transaction date" is used. (Available from FA 3.1 onward)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 44 p.keyFigures No Key figures Define the key figure code and individual observations as date-value pairs as a comma-separated list with the format <code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>:<code>=<date:yyyy-MM-dd>=<value>,... For example, AAA=2009-01-01=1.9,2010-01-01=1.10:TAX=2007-01-01=1,2010-01-01=2 You can use *** syntax to add new observations to the list and keep the existing ones. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios. (Available from FA 3.4 onward)

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 45 p.aggregatingSubportfolios No Aggregation of subportfolios Define as a number: 0 = Sum up values1 = Recalculate values

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 46 p.locked No Locked Define as a number: 0 = Not locked (default)1 = Locked

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 47 p.postingsOnParent No Generate postings on parent level Define as a number: 0 = Generate postings on portfolio level1 = Generate postings on parent portfolio level

title: FA Format for importing portfolios
body: 48 p.securityGroups No Security groups Security groups the portfolio is linked to. Specify the security groups as a comma-separated list of group codes. You can use *** to add new groups to the security while keeping the existing ones. For example: ***, <group code>. For details, see Updating contacts and portfolios.
